Limited resources. The business may have limited resources such as employees, equipment, and office space. This can lead to inefficiencies and reduced productivity.

Unfamiliarity with the market. Starting a new business requires a deep understanding of the market and customer needs. Without sufficient market research, the business may struggle to find the right customer base.
Competition. New businesses often face stiff competition from established players in the market, making it difficult to attract customers and retain them.
Lack of experience. Starting a business requires a certain level of expertise and experience. Without it, the business may not be able to make informed decisions and succeed.
Regulations and compliance. Depending on the industry, businesses must comply with various regulations and standards, which can be time-consuming and costly.
